info.title: Unified Data Library Services API
info.description: Unified Data Library Services OpenAPI v3 documentation.

tags.name: Link Status
tags.description: These services provide operations for manipulation and querying tactical data links and link statuses of beams or a satellite constellation. Communication link statuses provide definitions and status such as, positional endpoints, where each endpoint may be associated with a specific beam or with a satellite constellation. Data links provide detailed instructions regarding the operational use of a tactical data link and interface coordination through various message formats.

post.description: Service operation to take multiple datalink records as a POST body and ingest into the database. This operation is intended to be used for automated feeds into UDL. A specific role is required to perform this service operation. Please contact the UDL team for assistance.

get.description: Service operation to dynamically query data by a variety of query parameters not specified in this API documentation. See the queryhelp operation (/udl/<datatype>/queryhelp) for more details on valid/required query parameter information.

406.description: MediaType Not Accepted by Request Headers

429.description: Rate of Requests Exceeds Allowed Limit

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: The start of the effective time period of this data link message, in ISO 8601 UTC format with millisecond precision. (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ)

post.description: Service operation to take a single DataLink record as a POST body and ingest into the database. A specific role is required to perform this service operation. Please contact the UDL team for assistance.

429.description: Rate of Requests Exceeds Allowed Limit

get.description: Service operation to return the count of records satisfying the specified query parameters. This operation is useful to determine how many records pass a particular query criteria without retrieving large amounts of data. See the queryhelp operation (/udl/<datatype>/queryhelp) for more details on valid/required query parameter information.

406.description: MediaType Not Accepted by Request Headers

429.description: Rate of Requests Exceeds Allowed Limit

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: The start of the effective time period of this data link message, in ISO 8601 UTC format with millisecond precision. (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ)

get.description: Service operation to provide detailed information on available dynamic query parameters for a particular data type.

406.description: MediaType Not Accepted by Request Headers

429.description: Rate of Requests Exceeds Allowed Limit

get.description: Service operation to dynamically query data and only return specified columns/fields. Requested columns are specified by the 'columns' query parameter and should be a comma separated list of valid fields for the specified data type. classificationMarking is always returned. See the queryhelp operation (/udl/<datatype>/queryhelp) for more details on valid/required query parameter information. An example URI: /udl/elset/tuple?columns=satNo,period&epoch=>now-5 hours would return the satNo and period of elsets with an epoch greater than 5 hours ago.

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of valid field names for this data type to be returned in the response. Only the fields specified will be returned as well as the classification marking of the data, if applicable. See the ‘queryhelp’ operation for a complete list of possible fields.
parameters.name: columns
startTime
parameters.description: The start of the effective time period of this data link message, in ISO 8601 UTC format with millisecond precision. (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ)

406.description: MediaType Not Accepted by Request Headers

429.description: Rate of Requests Exceeds Allowed Limit

get.description: Service operation to dynamically query data by a variety of query parameters not specified in this API documentation. See the queryhelp operation (/udl/<datatype>/queryhelp) for more details on valid/required query parameter information.

406.description: MediaType Not Accepted by Request Headers

429.description: Rate of Requests Exceeds Allowed Limit

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description: (One or more of fields 'createdAt, linkStartTime, linkStopTime' are required.) Time the row was created in the database, auto-populated by the system. (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ)

parameters.name: linkStartTime
parameters.description: (One or more of fields 'createdAt, linkStartTime, linkStopTime' are required.) The link establishment time, or the time that the link becomes available for use, in ISO8601 UTC format. (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.ssssssZ)

parameters.name: linkStopTime
parameters.description: (One or more of fields 'createdAt, linkStartTime, linkStopTime' are required.) The link termination time, or the time that the link becomes unavailable for use, in ISO8601 UTC format. (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.ssssssZ)

post.description: Service operation to take a single LinkStatus as a POST body and ingest into the database. A specific role is required to perform this service operation. Please contact the UDL team for assistance.

429.description: Rate of Requests Exceeds Allowed Limit

get.description: Service operation to get a single LinkStatus record by its unique ID passed as a path parameter.

parameters.description: The ID of the LinkStatus to find.
parameters.name: id

get.description: Service operation to dynamically query historical data by a variety of query parameters not specified in this API documentation.  See the queryhelp operation (/udl/<datatype>/queryhelp) for more details on valid/required query parameter information.

parameters.description: optional, fields for retrieval. When omitted, ALL fields are assumed. See the queryhelp operation (/udl/<datatype>/queryhelp) for more details on valid query fields that can be selected.
parameters.name: columns
createdAt
parameters.description: (One or more of fields 'createdAt, linkStartTime, linkStopTime' are required.) Time the row was created in the database, auto-populated by the system. (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ)

get.description: Service operation to dynamically query historical data by a variety of query parameters not specified in this API documentation, then write that data to the Secure Content Store.  See the queryhelp operation (/udl/<datatype>/queryhelp) for more details on valid/required query parameter information.

parameters.description: optional, fields for retrieval. When omitted, ALL fields are assumed. See the queryhelp operation (/udl/<datatype>/queryhelp) for more details on valid query fields that can be selected.
parameters.name: columns

parameters.description: optional, notification method for the created file link. When omitted, EMAIL is assumed. Current valid values are: EMAIL, SMS.
parameters.name: notification

parameters.description: optional, field delimiter when the created file is not JSON. Must be a single character chosen from this set: (',', ';', ':', '|'). When omitted, "," is used. It is strongly encouraged that your field delimiter be a character unlikely to occur within the data.
parameters.name: outputDelimiter

parameters.description: optional, output format for the file. When omitted, JSON is assumed. Current valid values are: JSON and CSV.
parameters.name: outputFormat
createdAt
parameters.description: (One or more of fields 'createdAt, linkStartTime, linkStopTime' are required.) Time the row was created in the database, auto-populated by the system. (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ)

parameters.name: linkStartTime
parameters.description: (One or more of fields 'createdAt, linkStartTime, linkStopTime' are required.) The link establishment time, or the time that the link becomes available for use, in ISO8601 UTC format. (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.ssssssZ)

parameters.name: linkStopTime
parameters.description: (One or more of fields 'createdAt, linkStartTime, linkStopTime' are required.) The link termination time, or the time that the link becomes unavailable for use, in ISO8601 UTC format. (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.ssssssZ)

DataLink_Abridged.description: Beta Version DataLink: Detailed instructions regarding the operations of data links.

id.description: Unique identifier of the record, auto-generated by the system if not provided on create operations.

classificationMarking.description: Classification marking of the data in IC/CAPCO Portion-marked format.

opExName.description: Specifies the unique operation or exercise name, nickname, or codeword assigned to a joint exercise or operation plan.

originator.description: The identifier of the originator of this message.

startTime.description: The start of the effective time period of this data link message, in ISO 8601 UTC format with millisecond precision.

stopTime.description: The end of the effective time period of this data link message, in ISO 8601 UTC format with millisecond precision. This may be a relative stop time if used with stopTimeMod.

stopTimeMod.description: A qualifier for the end of the effective time period of this data link message, such as AFTER, ASOF, NLT, etc. Used with field stopTime to indicate a relative time.

planOrigNum.description: The official identifier of the military establishment responsible for the operation plan and the identification number assigned to this plan.

opExInfo.description: Provides an additional caveat further identifying the exercise or modifies the exercise nickname.

opExInfoAlt.description: The secondary nickname of the option or the alternative of the operational plan or order.

serialNum.description: The unique message identifier assigned by the originator.

month.description: The month in which this message originated.

qualifier.description: The qualifier which caveats the message status such as AMP (Amplification), CHG (Change), etc.

qualSN.description: The serial number associated with the message qualifier.

references.description: Collection of reference information. There can be 0 to many DataLinkReferences collections within the datalink service.

canxId.description: The identifier for this data link message cancellation.

canxOriginator.description: The originator of this data link message cancellation.

canxTs.description: Timestamp of the data link message cancellation, in ISO 8601 UTC format with millisecond precision.

canxSerialNum.description: Serial number assigned to this data link message cancellation.

canxSpecialNotation.description: Indicates any special actions, restrictions, guidance, or information relating to this data link message cancellation.

canxSICs.description: Array of NATO Subject Indicator Codes (SIC) or filing numbers of this data link message or document being cancelled.

pocName.description: The name of the point of contact for this data link message.

pocRank.description: The rank or position of the point of contact for this data link message in a military or civilian organization.

pocCallSign.description: The unit identifier or call sign of the point of contact for this data link message.

pocLocName.description: The location name of the point of contact for this data link message.

pocLat.description: WGS84 latitude of the point of contact for this data link message, in degrees. -90 to 90 degrees (negative values south of equator).

pocLon.description: WGS84 longitude of the point of contact for this data link message, in degrees. -180 to 180 degrees (negative values west of Prime Meridian).

pocNums.description: Array of telephone numbers, radio frequency values, or email addresses of the point of contact for this data link message.

geoDatum.description: The code for the point of reference from which the coordinates and networks are computed.

refPoints.description: Collection that identifies points of reference used in the establishment of the data links. There can be 1 to many DataLinkRefPoints collections within the datalink service.

voiceCoord.description: Collection of information regarding the function, frequency, and priority of interface control and coordination nets for this data link message. There can be 1 to many DataLinkVoiceCoord collections within the datalink service.

sysDefaultCode.description: Indicates the data terminal settings the system defaults to, either automatic correlation/decorrelation (AUTO) or manual (MAN).

winSizeMult.description: The correlation window size multiplier to stretch or reduce the window size. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entries are 0.5 to 3.0 in increments of 0.1.

winSizeMin.description: Number added to the basic window calculated from track qualities to ensure that windows still allow valid correlations. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entries are 0.0 to 2.0 in increments of 0.25.

minTrackQual.description: Track quality to prevent correlation windows from being unrealistically large. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entries are integers from 3 to 7.

maxTrackQual.description: Track quality to prevent correlation windows from being unrealistically small. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entries are integers from 8 to 15.

resTrackQual.description: Track quality to enter if too many duals involving low track quality tracks are occurring. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entries are integers from 2 to 6.

courseDiff.description: Maximum difference between the reported course of the remote track and the calculated course of the local track. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entries are 15 to 90 in increments of 15 degrees.

speedDiff.description: Maximum percentage the faster track speed may differ from the slower track speed. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entries are 10 to 100 in increments of 10.

altDiff.description: Maximum altitude difference between two air tracks, in thousands of feet. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entires are 5 to 50 in increments of 5000 feet.

minGeoPosQual.description: Number used for minimum geodetic position quality. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entries are integers from 1 to 5.

maxGeoPosQual.description: Number used for maximum geodetic position quality. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entires are integers from 1 to 15.

decorrWinMult.description: Distance between the common and remote track is to exceed the applicable correlation window for the two tracks in order to be decorrelated. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entries are 1.0 to 2.0 in increments of 0.1.

consecDecorr.description: Number of consecutive remote track reports that must meet the decorrelation criteria before the decorrelation is executed. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entries are integers from 1 to 5.

multiDuty.description: Collection of contact and identification information for designated multilink coordinator duty assignments. There can be 0 to many DataLinkMultiDuty collections within the datalink service.

ops.description: Collection of information describing the establishment and detailed operation of tactical data links. There can be 0 to many DataLinkOps collections within the datalink service.

jreUnitDes.description: Designator of the unit for Joint Range Extension (JRE).

jreCallSign.description: Call sign which identifies one or more communications facilities, commands, authorities, or activities for Joint Range Extension (JRE) units.

jrePriAdd.description: Link-16 octal track number assigned as the primary JTIDS unit address.

jreSecAdd.description: Link-16 octal track number assigned as the secondary JTIDS unit address.

specTracks.description: Collection of special track numbers used on the data links. There can be 0 to many DataLinkSpecTracks collections within the datalink service.

nonLinkUnitDes.description: Array of non-link specific data unit designators.

trackNumBlockLLs.description: Array of Link-16 octal track numbers used as the lower limit of a track block.

trackNumBlocks.description: Array of defined ranges of Link-11/11B track numbers assigned to a participating unit or reporting unit.

mgmtCodeMeaning.description: Data link management code word meaning.

ackReq.description: Flag Indicating if formal acknowledgement is required for the particular data link message being sent.

ackInstUnits.description: Array of instructions for acknowledging and the force or units required to acknowledge the data link message being sent.

classSource.description: Markings that define the source material or the original classification authority for this data link message.

classReasons.description: Array of codes that indicate the reasons material is classified.

decInstDates.description: Array of markings that provide the literal guidance or dates for the downgrading or declassification of this data link message.

decExemptCodes.description: Array of codes that provide justification for exemption from automatic downgrading or declassification.

remarks.description: Collection of remarks associated with this data link message.

rawFileURI.description: Optional URI location in the document repository of the raw file parsed by the system to produce this record. To download the raw file, prepend https://udl-hostname/scs/download?id= to this value.

createdAt.description: Time the row was created in the database, auto-populated by the system.

createdBy.description: Application user who created the row in the database, auto-populated by the system.

updatedAt.description: Time the row was updated in the database, auto-populated by the system.

updatedBy.description: Application user who updated the row in the database, auto-populated by the system.

sourceDL.description: The source data library from which this record was received. This could be a remote or tactical UDL or another data library. If null, the record should be assumed to have originated from the primary Enterprise UDL.

origin.description: Originating system or organization which produced the data, if different from the source. The origin may be different than the source if the source was a mediating system which forwarded the data on behalf of the origin system. If null, the source may be assumed to be the origin.

origNetwork.description: The originating source network on which this record was created, auto-populated by the system.

dataMode.description:
Indicator of whether the data is EXERCISE, REAL, SIMULATED, or TEST data:

EXERCISE: Data pertaining to a government or military exercise. The data may include both real and simulated data.

REAL: Data collected or produced that pertains to real-world objects, events, and analysis.

SIMULATED: Synthetic data generated by a model to mimic real-world datasets.

TEST: Specific datasets used to evaluate compliance with specifications and requirements, and for validating technical, functional, and performance characteristics.

REAL: Data collected or produced that pertains to real-world objects, events, and analysis.

SIMULATED: Synthetic data generated by a model to mimic real-world datasets.

TEST: Specific datasets used to evaluate compliance with specifications and requirements, and for validating technical, functional, and performance characteristics.

DataLink_Ingest.description: Beta Version DataLink: Detailed instructions regarding the operations of data links.

id.description: Unique identifier of the record, auto-generated by the system if not provided on create operations.

classificationMarking.description: Classification marking of the data in IC/CAPCO Portion-marked format.

opExName.description: Specifies the unique operation or exercise name, nickname, or codeword assigned to a joint exercise or operation plan.

originator.description: The identifier of the originator of this message.

startTime.description: The start of the effective time period of this data link message, in ISO 8601 UTC format with millisecond precision.

stopTime.description: The end of the effective time period of this data link message, in ISO 8601 UTC format with millisecond precision. This may be a relative stop time if used with stopTimeMod.

stopTimeMod.description: A qualifier for the end of the effective time period of this data link message, such as AFTER, ASOF, NLT, etc. Used with field stopTime to indicate a relative time.

planOrigNum.description: The official identifier of the military establishment responsible for the operation plan and the identification number assigned to this plan.

opExInfo.description: Provides an additional caveat further identifying the exercise or modifies the exercise nickname.

opExInfoAlt.description: The secondary nickname of the option or the alternative of the operational plan or order.

serialNum.description: The unique message identifier assigned by the originator.

month.description: The month in which this message originated.

qualifier.description: The qualifier which caveats the message status such as AMP (Amplification), CHG (Change), etc.

qualSN.description: The serial number associated with the message qualifier.

references.description: Collection of reference information. There can be 0 to many DataLinkReferences collections within the datalink service.

canxId.description: The identifier for this data link message cancellation.

canxOriginator.description: The originator of this data link message cancellation.

canxTs.description: Timestamp of the data link message cancellation, in ISO 8601 UTC format with millisecond precision.

canxSerialNum.description: Serial number assigned to this data link message cancellation.

canxSpecialNotation.description: Indicates any special actions, restrictions, guidance, or information relating to this data link message cancellation.

canxSICs.description: Array of NATO Subject Indicator Codes (SIC) or filing numbers of this data link message or document being cancelled.

pocName.description: The name of the point of contact for this data link message.

pocRank.description: The rank or position of the point of contact for this data link message in a military or civilian organization.

pocCallSign.description: The unit identifier or call sign of the point of contact for this data link message.

pocLocName.description: The location name of the point of contact for this data link message.

pocLat.description: WGS84 latitude of the point of contact for this data link message, in degrees. -90 to 90 degrees (negative values south of equator).

pocLon.description: WGS84 longitude of the point of contact for this data link message, in degrees. -180 to 180 degrees (negative values west of Prime Meridian).

pocNums.description: Array of telephone numbers, radio frequency values, or email addresses of the point of contact for this data link message.

geoDatum.description: The code for the point of reference from which the coordinates and networks are computed.

refPoints.description: Collection that identifies points of reference used in the establishment of the data links. There can be 1 to many DataLinkRefPoints collections within the datalink service.

voiceCoord.description: Collection of information regarding the function, frequency, and priority of interface control and coordination nets for this data link message. There can be 1 to many DataLinkVoiceCoord collections within the datalink service.

sysDefaultCode.description: Indicates the data terminal settings the system defaults to, either automatic correlation/decorrelation (AUTO) or manual (MAN).

winSizeMult.description: The correlation window size multiplier to stretch or reduce the window size. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entries are 0.5 to 3.0 in increments of 0.1.

winSizeMin.description: Number added to the basic window calculated from track qualities to ensure that windows still allow valid correlations. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entries are 0.0 to 2.0 in increments of 0.25.

minTrackQual.description: Track quality to prevent correlation windows from being unrealistically large. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entries are integers from 3 to 7.

maxTrackQual.description: Track quality to prevent correlation windows from being unrealistically small. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entries are integers from 8 to 15.

resTrackQual.description: Track quality to enter if too many duals involving low track quality tracks are occurring. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entries are integers from 2 to 6.

courseDiff.description: Maximum difference between the reported course of the remote track and the calculated course of the local track. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entries are 15 to 90 in increments of 15 degrees.

speedDiff.description: Maximum percentage the faster track speed may differ from the slower track speed. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entries are 10 to 100 in increments of 10.

altDiff.description: Maximum altitude difference between two air tracks, in thousands of feet. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entires are 5 to 50 in increments of 5000 feet.

minGeoPosQual.description: Number used for minimum geodetic position quality. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entries are integers from 1 to 5.

maxGeoPosQual.description: Number used for maximum geodetic position quality. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entires are integers from 1 to 15.

decorrWinMult.description: Distance between the common and remote track is to exceed the applicable correlation window for the two tracks in order to be decorrelated. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entries are 1.0 to 2.0 in increments of 0.1.

consecDecorr.description: Number of consecutive remote track reports that must meet the decorrelation criteria before the decorrelation is executed. Required if sysDefaultCode field is "MAN". Allowable entries are integers from 1 to 5.

multiDuty.description: Collection of contact and identification information for designated multilink coordinator duty assignments. There can be 0 to many DataLinkMultiDuty collections within the datalink service.

ops.description: Collection of information describing the establishment and detailed operation of tactical data links. There can be 0 to many DataLinkOps collections within the datalink service.

jreUnitDes.description: Designator of the unit for Joint Range Extension (JRE).

jreCallSign.description: Call sign which identifies one or more communications facilities, commands, authorities, or activities for Joint Range Extension (JRE) units.

jrePriAdd.description: Link-16 octal track number assigned as the primary JTIDS unit address.

jreSecAdd.description: Link-16 octal track number assigned as the secondary JTIDS unit address.

specTracks.description: Collection of special track numbers used on the data links. There can be 0 to many DataLinkSpecTracks collections within the datalink service.

nonLinkUnitDes.description: Array of non-link specific data unit designators.

trackNumBlockLLs.description: Array of Link-16 octal track numbers used as the lower limit of a track block.

trackNumBlocks.description: Array of defined ranges of Link-11/11B track numbers assigned to a participating unit or reporting unit.

mgmtCodeMeaning.description: Data link management code word meaning.

ackReq.description: Flag Indicating if formal acknowledgement is required for the particular data link message being sent.

ackInstUnits.description: Array of instructions for acknowledging and the force or units required to acknowledge the data link message being sent.

classSource.description: Markings that define the source material or the original classification authority for this data link message.

classReasons.description: Array of codes that indicate the reasons material is classified.

decInstDates.description: Array of markings that provide the literal guidance or dates for the downgrading or declassification of this data link message.

decExemptCodes.description: Array of codes that provide justification for exemption from automatic downgrading or declassification.

remarks.description: Collection of remarks associated with this data link message.

rawFileURI.description: Optional URI location in the document repository of the raw file parsed by the system to produce this record. To download the raw file, prepend https://udl-hostname/scs/download?id= to this value.

createdAt.description: Time the row was created in the database, auto-populated by the system.

createdBy.description: Application user who created the row in the database, auto-populated by the system.

updatedAt.description: Time the row was updated in the database, auto-populated by the system.

updatedBy.description: Application user who updated the row in the database, auto-populated by the system.

sourceDL.description: The source data library from which this record was received. This could be a remote or tactical UDL or another data library. If null, the record should be assumed to have originated from the primary Enterprise UDL.

origin.description: Originating system or organization which produced the data, if different from the source. The origin may be different than the source if the source was a mediating system which forwarded the data on behalf of the origin system. If null, the source may be assumed to be the origin.

origNetwork.description: The originating source network on which this record was created, auto-populated by the system.

dataMode.description:
Indicator of whether the data is EXERCISE, REAL, SIMULATED, or TEST data:

EXERCISE: Data pertaining to a government or military exercise. The data may include both real and simulated data.

REAL: Data collected or produced that pertains to real-world objects, events, and analysis.

SIMULATED: Synthetic data generated by a model to mimic real-world datasets.

TEST: Specific datasets used to evaluate compliance with specifications and requirements, and for validating technical, functional, and performance characteristics.

id.description: Unique identifier of the record, auto-generated by the system.

classificationMarking.description: Classification marking of the data in IC/CAPCO Portion-marked format.

idOnOrbit1.description: Unique ID of the on-orbit satellite (Sat-1) forming the link.  A null value for idOnOrbit1 indicates that the link is formed over a LEO/MEO constellation.

idOnOrbit2.description: Unique ID of the on-orbit satellite (Sat-2) forming the link.  A null value for idOnOrbit2 indicates either a link employing only Sat-1 or a link formed over a LEO/MEO constellation.

linkStartTime.description: The link establishment time, or the time that the link becomes available for use, in ISO8601 UTC format.

linkStopTime.description: The link termination time, or the time that the link becomes unavailable for use, in ISO8601 UTC format.

constellation.description: The constellation name if the link is established over a LEO/MEO constellation.  In this case, idOnOrbit1 and idOnOrbit2 will be null.

linkName.description: The name or description of the link.

band.description: The RF band employed by the link (e.g. MIL-KA, COM-KA, X-BAND, C-BAND, etc.).

idBeam1.description: The ID of beam-1 forming the link.  In the case of two sat link, beam-1 corresponds to Sat-1.

endPoint1Name.description: The name or description of link endpoint-1, corresponding to beam-1.

endPoint1Lat.description: Latitude of link endpoint-1, WGS-84 in degrees. -90 to 90 degrees (negative values south of equator).

endPoint1Lon.description: Longitude of link endpoint-1, WGS-84 longitude in degrees. -180 to 180 degrees (negative values west of Prime Meridian).

idBeam2.description: The ID of beam-2 forming the link.  In the case of two sat link, beam-2 corresponds to Sat-2.

endPoint2Name.description: The name or description of link endpoint-2, corresponding to beam-2.

endPoint2Lat.description: Latitude of link endpoint-2, WGS-84 in degrees. -90 to 90 degrees (negative values south of equator).

endPoint2Lon.description: Longitude of link endpoint-2, WGS-84 longitude in degrees. -180 to 180 degrees (negative values west of Prime Meridian).

dataRate1To2.description: The endpoint-1 to endpoint-2 data rate, in kbps.

dataRate2To1.description: The endpoint-2 to endpoint-1 data rate, in kbps.

linkState.description: The state of the link (e.g. OK, DEGRADED-WEATHER, DEGRADED-EMI, etc.).

sysCap.description: The SYSCAP mission status of the system(s) forming the link.

opsCap.description: The OPSCAP mission status of the system(s) forming the link.

createdAt.description: Time the row was created in the database, auto-populated by the system.

createdBy.description: Application user who created the row in the database, auto-populated by the system.

origin.description: Originating system or organization which produced the data, if different from the source. The origin may be different than the source if the source was a mediating system which forwarded the data on behalf of the origin system. If null, the source may be assumed to be the origin.

origNetwork.description: The originating source network on which this record was created, auto-populated by the system.

dataMode.description:
Indicator of whether the data is EXERCISE, REAL, SIMULATED, or TEST data:

EXERCISE: Data pertaining to a government or military exercise. The data may include both real and simulated data.

REAL: Data collected or produced that pertains to real-world objects, events, and analysis.

SIMULATED: Synthetic data generated by a model to mimic real-world datasets.

TEST: Specific datasets used to evaluate compliance with specifications and requirements, and for validating technical, functional, and performance characteristics.

satNo1.description: Satellite/catalog number of the target on-orbit primary object.

satNo2.description: Satellite/catalog number of the target on-orbit secondary object.

classificationMarking.description: Classification marking of the data in IC/CAPCO Portion-marked format.

idOnOrbit1.description: Unique ID of the on-orbit satellite (Sat-1) forming the link.  A null value for idOnOrbit1 indicates that the link is formed over a LEO/MEO constellation.

idOnOrbit2.description: Unique ID of the on-orbit satellite (Sat-2) forming the link.  A null value for idOnOrbit2 indicates either a link employing only Sat-1 or a link formed over a LEO/MEO constellation.

linkStartTime.description: The link establishment time, or the time that the link becomes available for use, in ISO8601 UTC format.

linkStopTime.description: The link termination time, or the time that the link becomes unavailable for use, in ISO8601 UTC format.

constellation.description: The constellation name if the link is established over a LEO/MEO constellation.  In this case, idOnOrbit1 and idOnOrbit2 will be null.

band.description: The RF band employed by the link (e.g. MIL-KA, COM-KA, X-BAND, C-BAND, etc.).

idBeam1.description: The ID of beam-1 forming the link.  In the case of two sat link, beam-1 corresponds to Sat-1.

endPoint1Name.description: The name or description of link endpoint-1, corresponding to beam-1.

endPoint1Lat.description: Latitude of link endpoint-1, WGS-84 in degrees. -90 to 90 degrees (negative values south of equator).

endPoint1Lon.description: Longitude of link endpoint-1, WGS-84 longitude in degrees. -180 to 180 degrees (negative values west of Prime Meridian).

idBeam2.description: The ID of beam-2 forming the link.  In the case of two sat link, beam-2 corresponds to Sat-2.

endPoint2Name.description: The name or description of link endpoint-2, corresponding to beam-2.

endPoint2Lat.description: Latitude of link endpoint-2, WGS-84 in degrees. -90 to 90 degrees (negative values south of equator).

endPoint2Lon.description: Longitude of link endpoint-2, WGS-84 longitude in degrees. -180 to 180 degrees (negative values west of Prime Meridian).

dataRate1To2.description: The endpoint-1 to endpoint-2 data rate, in kbps.

dataRate2To1.description: The endpoint-2 to endpoint-1 data rate, in kbps.

sysCap.description: The SYSCAP mission status of the system(s) forming the link.

opsCap.description: The OPSCAP mission status of the system(s) forming the link.

createdAt.description: Time the row was created in the database, auto-populated by the system.

createdBy.description: Application user who created the row in the database, auto-populated by the system.

origin.description: Originating system or organization which produced the data, if different from the source. The origin may be different than the source if the source was a mediating system which forwarded the data on behalf of the origin system. If null, the source may be assumed to be the origin.

origNetwork.description: The originating source network on which this record was created, auto-populated by the system.

dataMode.description:
Indicator of whether the data is EXERCISE, REAL, SIMULATED, or TEST data:

EXERCISE: Data pertaining to a government or military exercise. The data may include both real and simulated data.

REAL: Data collected or produced that pertains to real-world objects, events, and analysis.

SIMULATED: Synthetic data generated by a model to mimic real-world datasets.

TEST: Specific datasets used to evaluate compliance with specifications and requirements, and for validating technical, functional, and performance characteristics.

satNo1.description: Satellite/catalog number of the target on-orbit primary object.

satNo2.description: Satellite/catalog number of the target on-orbit secondary object.

id.description: Unique identifier of the record, auto-generated by the system.

classificationMarking.description: Classification marking of the data in IC/CAPCO Portion-marked format.

idOnOrbit1.description: Unique ID of the on-orbit satellite (Sat-1) forming the link.  A null value for idOnOrbit1 indicates that the link is formed over a LEO/MEO constellation.

idOnOrbit2.description: Unique ID of the on-orbit satellite (Sat-2) forming the link.  A null value for idOnOrbit2 indicates either a link employing only Sat-1 or a link formed over a LEO/MEO constellation.

linkStartTime.description: The link establishment time, or the time that the link becomes available for use, in ISO8601 UTC format.

linkStopTime.description: The link termination time, or the time that the link becomes unavailable for use, in ISO8601 UTC format.

constellation.description: The constellation name if the link is established over a LEO/MEO constellation.  In this case, idOnOrbit1 and idOnOrbit2 will be null.

linkName.description: The name or description of the link.

band.description: The RF band employed by the link (e.g. MIL-KA, COM-KA, X-BAND, C-BAND, etc.).

idBeam1.description: The ID of beam-1 forming the link.  In the case of two sat link, beam-1 corresponds to Sat-1.

endPoint1Name.description: The name or description of link endpoint-1, corresponding to beam-1.

endPoint1Lat.description: Latitude of link endpoint-1, WGS-84 in degrees. -90 to 90 degrees (negative values south of equator).

endPoint1Lon.description: Longitude of link endpoint-1, WGS-84 longitude in degrees. -180 to 180 degrees (negative values west of Prime Meridian).

idBeam2.description: The ID of beam-2 forming the link.  In the case of two sat link, beam-2 corresponds to Sat-2.

endPoint2Name.description: The name or description of link endpoint-2, corresponding to beam-2.

endPoint2Lat.description: Latitude of link endpoint-2, WGS-84 in degrees. -90 to 90 degrees (negative values south of equator).

endPoint2Lon.description: Longitude of link endpoint-2, WGS-84 longitude in degrees. -180 to 180 degrees (negative values west of Prime Meridian).

dataRate1To2.description: The endpoint-1 to endpoint-2 data rate, in kbps.

dataRate2To1.description: The endpoint-2 to endpoint-1 data rate, in kbps.

linkState.description: The state of the link (e.g. OK, DEGRADED-WEATHER, DEGRADED-EMI, etc.).

sysCap.description: The SYSCAP mission status of the system(s) forming the link.

opsCap.description: The OPSCAP mission status of the system(s) forming the link.

createdAt.description: Time the row was created in the database, auto-populated by the system.

createdBy.description: Application user who created the row in the database, auto-populated by the system.

origin.description: Originating system or organization which produced the data, if different from the source. The origin may be different than the source if the source was a mediating system which forwarded the data on behalf of the origin system. If null, the source may be assumed to be the origin.

origNetwork.description: The originating source network on which this record was created, auto-populated by the system.

dataMode.description:
Indicator of whether the data is EXERCISE, REAL, SIMULATED, or TEST data:

EXERCISE: Data pertaining to a government or military exercise. The data may include both real and simulated data.

REAL: Data collected or produced that pertains to real-world objects, events, and analysis.

SIMULATED: Synthetic data generated by a model to mimic real-world datasets.

TEST: Specific datasets used to evaluate compliance with specifications and requirements, and for validating technical, functional, and performance characteristics.

satNo1.description: Satellite/catalog number of the target on-orbit primary object.

satNo2.description: Satellite/catalog number of the target on-orbit secondary object.
